page.title: 03ECOLOGY: Broughton Down
page.content: On the{downs}there are many different kinds of{trees.}The most common are beech, yew, oak and ash. There is hawthorn scrub growing on the slopes of the downs. Flowering{plants}include violets, cowslips and orchids. There are interesting types of{fungi}living on dead trees. Many signs of wild { {animals}can be seen; rabbits and deer have chewed the bark of trees, there are holes where foxes, rabbits and badgers live and there are ant-hills everywhere. There are vast numbers of {butterflies}up on Broughton Downs and some of them are very unusual. If you stand still for a while some of the butterflies rest on the banks; mostly you see tortoiseshell{ butterflies and large white, but sometimes you see brimstone, chalkhill blue, meadow brown, comma and lots more as well.
